title: Lolah's Chicken Adobo Recipe
description: You'll find the traditional flavors of Filipino Chicken Adobo in this updated recipe.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Lolah's Chicken Adobo 4.7 (65) 52 Reviews 17 Photos My Filipino Mom taught me how to make this traditional dish following the recipe her mother taught her. And though I've made a couple of changes, I guarantee they're Mom-approved. 'Lolah' is 'Grandma' in the Philippines, in case you were wondering. Serve over steamed rice. Submitted by foodelicious Updated on November 9, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 tablespoons vegetable oil 3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, rinsed and patted dry 6 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced ½ cup soy sauce ½ cup apple cider vinegar ½ cup water 2 tablespoons pickling spice, wrapped in cheesecloth Directions Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat until oil is shimmering. Cook garlic in oil for no more than 30 seconds. Add all of the chicken to the pot; cook, stirring frequently, until chicken is white all over. Do not brown. Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and water, and add the pickling spice. Make sure the spice ball is submerged. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and place lid on pot so that some steam can escape. Simmer for 1 hour, or until chicken is very tender. I Made It Print 170 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Lolah's Chicken Adobo 01 of 17 Photo by  foodelicious 02 of 17 Photo by  Gina Pegues 07/19/2021 03 of 17 Photo by  Vika Thayer 09/07/2020 04 of 17 Photo by  DeHoff Mommy 04/02/2020 05 of 17 Photo by  Blakk_Foxe 02/05/2020 The chicken just didn't taste finished. And the cider vinegar overpowered a lot of the taste. But it was good w/ some siracha sauce & black pepper on it. Would not make it again but only because it was to hard to make. 06 of 17 Photo by  Fabiola Sanabria Elias 06/07/2019 Easy and great flavor. Added 2 more very large cloves of garlic for a total of 8 cloves, and for pickling spices, I used crushed peppercorns, bay leaves, and cinnamon stick. My husband said that the adobo he’s had before is sweet but he liked this one better. My 6 year old loved it. Served it over jasmine rice and sautéed onions and zucchini in a buttery cream sauce on the side. 07 of 17 Photo by  Robin Leighbuchanan 12/28/2017 08 of 17 Photo by  Diana71 07/03/2017 Delicious adobo recipe! I love the use of the spice packet. My family always added relish into the sauce...this tastes pretty much the same, with the perfect tang. BTW, the sauce is PERFECT over rice. Thanks for Lolah's recipe!!! 09 of 17 Photo by  gwenc68 01/06/2017 10 of 17 Photo by  Kat Etchemendy 10/22/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Pinoy Chicken Adobo 38 Ratings Siopao Chicken and Pork Filling Chicken Salpicao 1 Rating Filipino Chicken Adobo 2 Ratings Famous Chicken Adobo 364 Ratings Slow Cooker Filipino Chicken Adobo 17 Ratings Grilled Chicken Adobo 253 Ratings Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy 206 Ratings Pork and Chicken Adobo 9 Ratings Guinataan Chicken Adobo 36 Ratings Chicken Adobo I 49 Ratings Adobo Chicken with Ginger 370 Ratings Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) 48 Ratings Bringhe 9 Ratings Authentic Chicken Adobo 20 Ratings Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo 31 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: foodelicious
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat until oil is shimmering. Cook garlic in oil for no more than 30 seconds. Add all of the chicken to the pot; cook, stirring frequently, until chicken is white all over. Do not brown.;Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and water, and add the pickling spice. Make sure the spice ball is submerged. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and place lid on pot so that some steam can escape. Simmer for 1 hour, or until chicken is very tender.
